author: catwith1hat
content:
Pardon my ignorance, again, I am only a small node operator, but in the context of the Holesky chaos, is the following CL feature possible?
```
curl -X POST http://localhost:5051/eth/v1/debug/leader \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "enr": "enr:-IS4QKvCAb_...",
    "expiry": "24h"
  }'
```
The above should make the CL spawns a background thread that queries that given enr every 5 minutes and reorgs the CL onto the state of this enr. The CL reorgs the EL as required. The API calls takes an expiry time for this activity. This way a node operator can say “Temporarily follow me this leader node”.

That way, I don't need to do custom peerings, and bootnode magics. This should even scale well. I could loosly follow a node that is loosly following another node. All we need do to mitigate is 1. agree on a leader enr, have 100 nodes follow that, and then have 100 * 100 nodes following the first set of nodes. Having that exposed to a curl-able API makes it easy for unskilled node operators to execute. The effect isn't permanent and is lost when the node restarts.

EDIT: Maybe instead of "query this enr every 5 minutes" it should be "query this enr before finalizing a new epoch", which is roughly equivalent. that logic would work better when syncing. the downside is that in my mitigation proposal, the leader nodes are almost ddos-ed, as all the queries of downstream nodes happen exactly at the same time.
